Title: (Gentoo Issues Fix) XChat Socks-5 Proxy Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A stack overflow vulnerability was reported in XChat in the Socks-5 proxy code.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system in certain cases.
The vendor reported that if socks5 traversal is enabled (not the default configuration), then a remote user with a malicious proxy server can trigger the overflow when the target user connects to the malicious proxy server.  Arbitrary code can be executed on the target user's system with the privileges of the user running the xchat process.

The vendor credits tsifra with discovering this bug.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on a target user's system when the target user connects to a malicious proxy server.
Solution:
Gentoo has released a fix and indicates that all XChat users should upgrade to the latest stable version:

    # emerge sync

    # emerge -pv ">=net-irc/xchat-2.0.8-r1"
    # emerge ">=net-irc/xchat-2.0.8-r1"

Gentoo also indicates that users of the gtk1 version of xchat (1.8.*) should upgrade to xchat-1.8.11-r1:

    # emerge sync

    # emerge -pv "=net-irc/xchat-1.8.11-r1"
    # emerge "=net-irc/xchat-1.8.11-r1"

Title: XChat Socks-5 Proxy Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A stack overflow vulnerability was reported in XChat in the Socks-5 proxy code.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system in certain cases.
The vendor reported that if socks5 traversal is enabled (not the default configuration), then a remote user with a malicious proxy server can trigger the overflow when the target user connects to the malicious proxy server.  Arbitrary code can be executed on the target user's system with the privileges of the user running the xchat process.

The vendor credits tsifra with discovering this bug.
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on a target user's system when the target user connects to a malicious proxy server.
Solution:
The vendor has released a source code patch, available at:

http://xchat.org/files/source/2.0/patches/
http://xchat.org/files/source/2.0/patches/xc208-fixsocks5.diff

The vendor also reports that the Fedora RPMs at http://www.xchat.org have been rebuilt with this patch applied.

Title: Trillian Saves Yahoo! Password in Plain Text to Local Temporary File in Certain Cases
Description:
Rafel Ivgi (The-Insider) reported a vulnerability in Trillian (when used with Yahoo! Messenger services).  A local user can obtain the target user's password.
It is reported that when a Yahoo! Messenger user receives an e-mail via Yahoo! mail, the system will display a pop-up window to prompt the target user to check their mail.  If the prompt is selected, the system reportedly writes an HTML file containing the target user's Yahoo! password to the Windows temporary folder.  The system also reportedly saves the "Remmeber me" login credentials without prompting for the user's approval.  The information is transmitted without session security (i.e., over HTTP), the report said.
Impact': A local user can obtain a target user's Yahoo! password in certain cases.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Yahoo! Messenger Saves Password in Plain Text to Local Temporary File in Certain Cases
Description:
Rafel Ivgi (The-Insider) reported a vulnerability in Yahoo! Messenger.  A local user can obtain the target user's password.
It is reported that when a Yahoo! Messenger user receives an e-mail via Yahoo! mail, the system will display a pop-up window to prompt the target user to check their mail.  If the prompt is selected, the system reportedly writes an HTML file containing the target user's Yahoo! password to the Windows temporary folder.  The system also reportedly saves the "Remmeber me" login credentials without prompting for the user's approval.  The information is transmitted without session security (i.e., over HTTP), the report said.
Impact': A local user can obtain a target user's Yahoo! password in certain cases.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Crackalaka IRC Server Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
Donato Ferrante reported a vulnerability in Crackalaka.  A remote user can cause the IRC service to crash.
It is reported that a remote user can send a specially crafted string to the target service to trigger a memory allocation flaw. The vulnerability resides in the hash_strcmp() function in 'hash.c'.

A demonstration exploit is provided:

nc [host] 6667 < /dev/urandom

The vendor has reportedly been notified.
Impact': A remote user can cause the IRC service to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Microsoft MSN Messenger May Disclose Known Files to Remote Users
Description:
An information disclosure vulnerability was reported in Microsoft MSN Messenger.  A remote user can access the contents of a known file on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.
It is reported that a remote user can send a specially crafted request to a target MSN Messenger user to view the contents of arbitrary files that have known locations on the target user's system and that are readable by the target user.  The remote user must know the sign-on name of the target user to be able to send a malicious request.

The vulnerability is due to a flaw in the processing of file requests communicated between two MSN Messenger accounts, where insufficient validation is performed when the session is created, the report said.

Windows Messenger is reportedly not affected.

Microsoft credits qFox and Mephisto with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view known files on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.
Solution:
Microsoft has issued a fix for Microsoft MSN Messenger 6.0 and 6.1, available at:

http://messenger.msn.com/

A restart may be required after applying this patch.

Title: Chat Anywhere '%00' Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Hide Their Session
Description:
Luigi Auriemma reported a vulnerability in Chat Anywhere.  A remote authenticated user can create a nickname that cannot be viewed by the administrator.
It is reported that a remote authenticated user can insert '%00' before the nickname to hide from the administrator.  The administrator will not be able to see the user's IP address on the administration page, as it will instead display '$IP$', the report said.

The administrator will reportedly not be able to ban the user or kick the user off.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://aluigi.altervista.org/poc/ca-ghost.htm
Impact': A remote authenticated user can hide their session from the administrator.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (2.72a), available at:

http://www.lionmax.com/download.htm#ca

A patch for version 2.72 is also available at:

http://www.wfshome.com/lionmax/upgrade_ca.exe

Title: ignitionServer Undocumented Command Lets Operators Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the ignitionServer.  A remote authenticated operator can obtain additional operator privileges.
It is reported that an operator can execute an undocumented command to give themselves any mode, including the ability to issue '/restart' and '/die' commands.  A local IRC operator can exploit this to become a global IRC operator, the report disclosed.
Impact': A remote authenticated operator can gain any mode.
Solution:
A fixed version (0.2.1-BRC1) is available at:

http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=96071

http://www.ignition-project.com/

Title: SkyHigh Chat Server Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
Donato Ferrante reported a vulnerability in the SkyHigh Chat Server.  A remote user can crash the chat service.
It is reported that a remote user can attempt to establish approximately 500 connections to the chat service to cause the target application to crash.  As a result, the application will list the following error:

Run-time error '1816'
Impact': A remote user can cause the chat service to crash.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note:  The vendor does not appear to have a web site at this time, even though the chat server zip file is still available.]

Title: Jabber Gadu-Gadu Transport May Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Some vulnerabilities were reported in Jabber Gadu-Gadu Transport.  A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
It is reported that a remote registered user can re-register to cause the system to enter an infinite loop.

The software contains other potential denial of service conditions, the report said.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target application.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (2.0.8), available at:

http://www.jabberstudio.org/projects/jabber-gg-transport/releases/

Title: FreeChat Server Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in FreeChat.  A remote user can cause the server to crash.
Donato Ferrante reported that a remote user can send a specially crafted string to the target server to cause the chat service to crash.

The following is a demonstration exploit string:

"aaaaa"

The vendor has reportedly been notified without response.
Impact': A remote user can cause the chat service to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Trillian Integer Overflow and Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Trillian 0.71-0.74 w/ patch f; Trillian Pro 1.0, 2.0, 2.01
Description:
Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities were reported in Trillian.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Stefan Esser of e-matters GmbH reported that Trillian is vulnerable to flaws recently discovered in the GAIM sourcecode.

A remote user can reportedly send a specially crafted DirectIM packet to trigger an integer overflow to execute arbitrary code.

It is also reported that a remote user can send a specially crafted Yahoo! Messenger packet with an oversied keyname to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code.

The report indicates that this second vulnerability can no longer be exploited via Yahoo! servers, but can be exploited via a man-in-the-middle attack.

The vendor was reportedly notified on February 18, 2004.

The original advisory is available at:

http://security.e-matters.de/advisories/022004.html
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has released a patch (0.74 Patch G), available at:

http://www.trillian.cc

Title: (Conectiva Issues Fix) Gaim Contains Multiple Overflows That Let a Remote User Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Gaim.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Stefan Esser of e-matters GmbH reported 12 vulnerabilities, including stack overflows, heap overflows, and an integer overflow. Some of the vulnerabilities require a man-in-the-middle attack to exploit.

Several of the vulnerabilities were due to buffer overflows in the processing of Yahoo! Messenger protocol.

An integer overflow was reported in the processing of the AIM/Oscar protocol.

A variety of other protocols and functions also contain overflows.

It is reported that two buffer overflows reside in the decoding of octal values in the yahoo_decode() function in 
'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0005].  Only version 0.75 is affected.

A remote server can send an HTTP reply header with specially crafted cookie values to trigger an overflow in 'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c' in the yahoo_web_pending() function [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

Two buffer overflows in yahoo_login_page_hash() can be triggered by specially crafted values in the Yahoo! login webpage [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

A remote user can send a Yahoo! Messenger packet containing a specially crafted keyname value to the target server via the Yahoo! server to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].  The flaw reportedly resides in the yahoo_packet_read() function in 'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c'.

It is reported that a malicious AIM/Oscar directIM packet can trigger an overflow in the handlehdr_odc() function in 'gaim/src/protocols/oscar/ft.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0008].  Versions 0.74 and prior are affected.

Two vulnerabilites were reported in the MIME decoding functions of quotedp_decode() in 'gaim/src/util.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0005].  Only version 0.75 is affected.

The gaim_url_parse() function in 'gaim/src/util.c' reportedly splits URLs into fixed sized buffers [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

The gaim_markup_extract_info_field() function in 'gaim/src/util.c' contains a stack overflow in several locations [CVE: CVE-2004-0007].  Versions 0.74 and earlier are affected.

A remote user acting as an HTTP proxy server can trigger an overflow in a connected Gaim client when the client is configured to use an HTTP proxy [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].  The flaw resides in the http_canread() function in 'gaim/src/proxy.c'.

The vendor was initially notified regarding the first of the bugs on January 4, 2004.

The original advisory is available at:

http://security.e-matters.de/advisories/012004.html
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  In some of the vulnerabilities, the remote user must be operating as a malicious server.  In some cases, the remote user must invoke a man-in-the-middle attack.  In one case, a remote user can simply send a message via the Yahoo! server.
Solution:
Conectiva has released a fix.

ftp://atualizacoes.conectiva.com.br/8/RPMS/gaim-0.59.8-1U80_1cl.i386.rpm
ftp://atualizacoes.conectiva.com.br/8/SRPMS/gaim-0.59.8-1U80_1cl.src.rpm
ftp://atualizacoes.conectiva.com.br/9/RPMS/gaim-0.75-27683U90_1cl.i386.rpm
ftp://atualizacoes.conectiva.com.br/9/SRPMS/gaim-0.75-27683U90_1cl.src.rpm

Title: (Vendor Issues Fix) Eggdrop Logic Flaw Grants Sharebot Status to Remote Bots
Description:
Giuseppe from nonsoloirc.com reported a vulnerability in Eggdrop in the 'share.mod' module.  A remote user may be able to gain control of an Eggdrop botnet.
Due to a logic error in 'share.c', a remote bot can reportedly gain STAT_OFFERED status.  With sharebot status, a remote user can add and delete users and perform other actions on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can obtain 'sharebot' status on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix, available via CVS.

Title: (Red Hat Issues Fix for RH Enterprise Linux) Gaim Contains Multiple Overflows That Let a Remote User Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Gaim.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

Solution:
Red Hat has released a fix.

Title: Eggdrop Logic Flaw Grants Sharebot Status to Remote Bots
Description:
Giuseppe from nonsoloirc.com reported a vulnerability in Eggdrop in the 'share.mod' module.  A remote user may be able to gain control of an Eggdrop botnet.
Due to a logic error in 'share.c', a remote bot can reportedly gain STAT_OFFERED status.  With sharebot status, a remote user can add and delete users and perform other actions on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can obtain 'sharebot' status on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

An unofficial patch is available in the Source Message.

Title: The Palace Client URL Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Peter Winter-Smith reported a stack overflow vulnerability in The Palace client software.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
It is reported that a remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.  It is also possible to create HTML that, when loaded, will automatically load the URL and trigger the flaw, the report said.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

palace://('a'x118)('BBBB')('XXXX')
Impact': A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system with the privileges of the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) Gaim Contains Multiple Overflows That Let a Remote User Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Gaim.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Stefan Esser of e-matters GmbH reported 12 vulnerabilities, including stack overflows, heap overflows, and an integer overflow. Some of the vulnerabilities require a man-in-the-middle attack to exploit.

Several of the vulnerabilities were due to buffer overflows in the processing of Yahoo! Messenger protocol.

An integer overflow was reported in the processing of the AIM/Oscar protocol.

A variety of other protocols and functions also contain overflows.

It is reported that two buffer overflows reside in the decoding of octal values in the yahoo_decode() function in 
'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0005].  Only version 0.75 is affected.

A remote server can send an HTTP reply header with specially crafted cookie values to trigger an overflow in 'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c' in the yahoo_web_pending() function [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

Two buffer overflows in yahoo_login_page_hash() can be triggered by specially crafted values in the Yahoo! login webpage [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

A remote user can send a Yahoo! Messenger packet containing a specially crafted keyname value to the target server via the Yahoo! server to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].  The flaw reportedly resides in the yahoo_packet_read() function in 'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c'.

It is reported that a malicious AIM/Oscar directIM packet can trigger an overflow in the handlehdr_odc() function in 'gaim/src/protocols/oscar/ft.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0008].  Versions 0.74 and prior are affected.

Two vulnerabilites were reported in the MIME decoding functions of quotedp_decode() in 'gaim/src/util.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0005].  Only version 0.75 is affected.

The gaim_url_parse() function in 'gaim/src/util.c' reportedly splits URLs into fixed sized buffers [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

The gaim_markup_extract_info_field() function in 'gaim/src/util.c' contains a stack overflow in several locations [CVE: CVE-2004-0007].  Versions 0.74 and earlier are affected.

A remote user acting as an HTTP proxy server can trigger an overflow in a connected Gaim client when the client is configured to use an HTTP proxy [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].  The flaw resides in the http_canread() function in 'gaim/src/proxy.c'.

The vendor was initially notified regarding the first of the bugs on January 4, 2004.

The original advisory is available at:

http://security.e-matters.de/advisories/012004.html
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  In some of the vulnerabilities, the remote user must be operating as a malicious server.  In some cases, the remote user must invoke a man-in-the-middle attack.  In one case, a remote user can simply send a message via the Yahoo! server.
Solution:
Debian has released a fix for the stable distribution (woody) in version 0.58-2.4 and for the unstable distribution (sid) in version 0.75-2.

Title: ChatterBox Server Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ChatterBox.  A remote user can crash the chat server.
Donato Ferrante reported that a remote user can send an irregular string to cause the target chat service to crash.   A remote user can reportedly send the following string to trigger the crash:

aaaaaa

The vendor was reportedly notified.
Impact': A remote user can cause the chat service to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Mandrake Issues Fix) Gaim Contains Multiple Overflows That Let a Remote User Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Gaim.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Stefan Esser of e-matters GmbH reported 12 vulnerabilities, including stack overflows, heap overflows, and an integer overflow. Some of the vulnerabilities require a man-in-the-middle attack to exploit.

Several of the vulnerabilities were due to buffer overflows in the processing of Yahoo! Messenger protocol.

An integer overflow was reported in the processing of the AIM/Oscar protocol.

A variety of other protocols and functions also contain overflows.

It is reported that two buffer overflows reside in the decoding of octal values in the yahoo_decode() function in 
'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0005].  Only version 0.75 is affected.

A remote server can send an HTTP reply header with specially crafted cookie values to trigger an overflow in 'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c' in the yahoo_web_pending() function [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

Two buffer overflows in yahoo_login_page_hash() can be triggered by specially crafted values in the Yahoo! login webpage [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

A remote user can send a Yahoo! Messenger packet containing a specially crafted keyname value to the target server via the Yahoo! server to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].  The flaw reportedly resides in the yahoo_packet_read() function in 'gaim/src/protocols/yahoo/yahoo.c'.

It is reported that a malicious AIM/Oscar directIM packet can trigger an overflow in the handlehdr_odc() function in 'gaim/src/protocols/oscar/ft.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0008].  Versions 0.74 and prior are affected.

Two vulnerabilites were reported in the MIME decoding functions of quotedp_decode() in 'gaim/src/util.c' [CVE: CVE-2004-0005].  Only version 0.75 is affected.

The gaim_url_parse() function in 'gaim/src/util.c' reportedly splits URLs into fixed sized buffers [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].

The gaim_markup_extract_info_field() function in 'gaim/src/util.c' contains a stack overflow in several locations [CVE: CVE-2004-0007].  Versions 0.74 and earlier are affected.

A remote user acting as an HTTP proxy server can trigger an overflow in a connected Gaim client when the client is configured to use an HTTP proxy [CVE: CVE-2004-0006].  The flaw resides in the http_canread() function in 'gaim/src/proxy.c'.

The vendor was initially notified regarding the first of the bugs on January 4, 2004.

The original advisory is available at:

http://security.e-matters.de/advisories/012004.html
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  In some of the vulnerabilities, the remote user must be operating as a malicious server.  In some cases, the remote user must invoke a man-in-the-middle attack.  In one case, a remote user can simply send a message via the Yahoo! server.
Solution:
Mandrake has released a fix.

Title: (Mandrake Issues Fix) jabberd SSL Connection Handling Flaw May Let Remote Users Crash the System
Description:
A denial of service vulnerability was reported in jabberd.  A remote user can cause the target jabberd service to crash.
It is reported that the software does not properly handle SSL connections, as non-blocking sockets are not used.  The flaw reportedly resides in 'mio_ssl.c'.

A remote user may be able to cause the target daemon to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the jabberd process to crash.
Solution:
Mandrake has released a fix.

Title: Yahoo! Messenger Download Filename Buffer Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Tri Huynh from SentryUnion reported a buffer overflow vulnerability in Yahoo! Messenger.  A remote user can send a file to a target user to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system when the target user attempts to download the file.
It is reported that a specially crafted long filename can trigger the flaw.  Arbitrary code execution may be possible.

As a demonstration exploit, the report indicates that you can send a file with the following type of filename:

test<insert around 210 spaces here>.jpg

The author notes that this flaw is different from the filename-related flaw reported in October 2003 [Editor's note:  See Alert ID 1008008].
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system when the target user attempts to download a file.  The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
Solution: It is reported that the flaw has been corrected in version 5.6.0.1358 but that the vendor has not disclosed the security issue. According to the report, existing users of vulnerable 5.6 versions cannot upgrade to the new version unless they reinstall the product.

Title: (Debian Issues Fix) jabberd SSL Connection Handling Flaw May Let Remote Users Crash the System
Description:
A denial of service vulnerability was reported in jabberd.  A remote user can cause the target jabberd service to crash.
It is reported that the software does not properly handle SSL connections, as non-blocking sockets are not used.  The flaw reportedly resides in 'mio_ssl.c'.

A remote user may be able to cause the target daemon to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the jabberd process to crash.
Solution:
Debian has released a fix for the current stable distribution (woody) in version 1.4.2a-1.1woody1 and for the unstable distribution (sid) in version 1.4.3-1.

Title: jabberd SSL Connection Handling Flaw May Let Remote Users Crash the System
Description:
A denial of service vulnerability was reported in jabberd.  A remote user can cause the target jabberd service to crash.
It is reported that the software does not properly handle SSL connections, as non-blocking sockets are not used.  The flaw reportedly resides in 'mio_ssl.c'.

A remote user may be able to cause the target daemon to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the jabberd process to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fixed version (1.4.3), available at:

http://jabberd.jabberstudio.org/1.4/dist/jabberd-1.4.3.tar.gz
http://jabberd.jabberstudio.org/1.4/#download

Title: (Mandrake Issues Fix) irssi Client Extraneous format_send_to_gui() Function Call Parameter Lets Remote Users Crash the Client
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the irssi client.  A remote IRC user can cause the target user's client to crash in certain situations.
It is reported that when irssi is running on an architecture that requires memory alignmentation (e.g., not the x86 architecture) and the "gui print text" signal is being used by a script or plugin, the flaw can be triggered.  The 'nicklist.pl' and 'tab_stop.pl' scripts use the affected signal, the report said.

The vulnerability is reportedly due to an extraneous 'str' parameter in the format_send_to_gui() function call in 'src/fe-common/core/formats.c'.

A remote user can send a specially crafted IRC message via an IRC server to cause the target user's irssi client to crash.

According to the report, arbitrary code execution is not possible.

Rico Gloeckner is credited with discovering this flaw and Wouter Coekaerts is credited with debugging the flaw.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's irssi client to crash.
Solution:
Mandrake has released a fix.
